intro: Hypoestes grandifolia, commonly known as the "Snowflake Plant," is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety, blue-green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil. Hypoestes grandifolia is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and compact growth habit.
